sourceMeaningMnemonic: For a <radical>car</radical>, the <radical>reason</radical> why it works is because its wheels spin on their <kanji>axis</kanji>. That is, they have <kanji>axle</kanji>s.
meaningInfo: Imagine a car whose wheels don't turn on their <kanji>axis</kanji>. It has no <kanji>axle</kanji>s. Not a car that will work too well.
readingMnemonic: Your friend's car doesn't have <kanji>axle</kanji>s, but he loves it anyway. He's all like, "Isn't this a cool car?" You reply: "<reading>Gee, coo</reading>l" (<ja>じく</ja>) very sarcastically.
readingInfo: You're super sarcastic about this, so feel the sarcasm inside of you when you imagine this.
